description: Users may experience unexpected behavior in their systems due to an elevation of privilege vulnerability in the kernel streaming service driver. This can manifest as unauthorized access attempts to critical system resources resulting in system instability. Symptoms may include sudden application crashes and potentially malicious modifications to system settings and files. Additionally, users may notice unexpected service denials or resource unavailability if the vulnerability is exploited. This issue affects multiple builds of Windows 10 and 11, specifically build numbers 22621.4169, 22000.3197, 22631.4169, and 26100.1742, referenced in the associated updates KB5043080, KB5043076, KB5043067, and KB5043064.
